pageContext.claim: “Today, I am pleased to announce that Foxconn, a world leader in manufacturing for computers, communications, and consumer electronics -- one of the truly great companies of the world -- will build a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility for the production of LCD panel products in Wisconsin, investing many, many billions of dollars right here in America and creating thousands of jobs. And I mean American jobs -- that's what we want.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump touted Foxconn's investment announcement, but the company considered investing in U.S.-based facilities since 2014, though its initial plans to invest in Pennsylvania didn't pan out. Moreover, the $3 billion incentives package offered by Wisconsin to lure Foxconn has not yet been approved by the Wisconsin Senate, amid concerns that the state would use taxpayer money for a project that would not generate profit for Wisconsin until 2042.
